metadata.title: CVE-2022-29800 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A time-of-check-time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition vulnerability was foundin networkd-dispatcher. This flaw exists because there is a certain timebetween the scripts being discovered and them being run. An attacker canabuse this vulnerability to replace scripts that networkd-dispatcherbelieves to be owned by root with ones that are not.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

networkd-dispatcher - 2.1-2~ubuntu20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: networkd-dispatcher package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-2~ubuntu20.04.2').
